page.title: 08INTERVIEW: MINISTER (cont.)
page.content: About 32 acres belong to the Church. The Sunday service takes place from 10.15 to 11.15 a.m. There is no Sunday School. Two people are employed by the Church. This year the 120th child was baptised. Next year the Communion cups are 250 years old. This year there have been 26 weddings, 6 funerals and 6 baptisms. The oldest gravestone is 273 years old. Church attendance is very high at Christmas, Easter and Communion. The local authority looks after the graveyard. The Presbytery of St. Andrews of which Rev. Douglas is the current Moderator will meet in Dunino Church for the first time ever this year. The present stipend is around Â£8000 whereas old records show the stipend as Â£97.19. 03d along with meal, measuring 54 bolls, 1 firlot and 1 peck! Dunino Parish exhibits healthy survival in spite of its small area.
